parts:
If by “crackling pork” you mean **Filipino style crispy pork / lechon / lechon kawali**, here are good spots in Singapore plus tips on what to ask for. If by “crackling pork” you meant something else (e.g. Chinese siew yoke, European pork crackling), I can also suggest for those.

---

## ✅ Filipino-style crackling / lechon / lechon kawali spots in Singapore

Here are some of the better known places where you can get a good Filipino crispy pork (or lechon) experience:

| Name | What they offer / specialty | Address / notes |
|---|---|---|
| **Lechon Republic** | A lechon specialist. They do roast pork with crisp skin, and you can order chopped lechon meals. citeturn0search4turn0search13turn0search2turn0search10 | 275 Thomson Rd, #01-09 Novena Regency | |
| **Don Lechon** | Signature is chopped lechon, roast pig, lechon Sisig etc. citeturn0search10turn0search2turn0search13turn0search4 | 511 Guillemard Rd, Grandlink Square, #01-52 citeturn0search10turn0search2 | |
| **Kabayan Filipino Restaurant** | They serve *Lechon Kawali with Egg & Garlic Rice* and “roasted pork” in their menu. citeturn0search1 | Lucky Plaza, 304 Orchard Road, #03-25 citeturn0search10turn0search1 | |
| **Kuya’s Kusinang Pinoy** | They are known for comforting Filipino food, including *lechon kawali* (deep-fried pork belly) citeturn0search2 | 420 North Bridge Road, #01-06, North Bridge Centre citeturn0search2 | |
| **Gerry’s Grill** | More of a Filipino grill chain; good fallback option for grilled / crispy pork / crispy pata. citeturn0search2turn0search10 | 51 Cuppage Road, Starhub Centre | |
| **Iskina Cebu Singapore** | They roast lechon the traditional way over charcoal. citeturn0search10turn0search2 | At Timbre+ citeturn0search10 | |
| **La Café & Bar** | They have *Lechon Kawali* on the menu among Filipino-fusion offerings. citeturn0search10 | 103 Irrawaddy Rd, #01-06, Royal Square @ Novena citeturn0search10 | |

Also, a smaller place:

- **Filipino Cuisine @ Kopitiam @ Jurong East MRT** — A food stall under Kopitiam at Jurong East MRT had “Filipino Cuisine” and offered *Lechon Kawali* (crispy pork belly) in earlier reports. citeturn0search0  
- There are also Facebook mentions of “Second Serving” doing lechon kawali etc. citeturn0search8  

From eat-guides, “8 places in Singapore to get decadently crispy Filipino lechon” is a good reference list. citeturn0search2

---

## 🧐 Tips: What to ask for / identify when ordering

To increase your chance of getting exactly the “crackling pork” style you want:

- Ask for **lechon (pig roast)** with **crispy skin / skin that crackles**.  
- Ask for **lechon kawali** — deep-fried pork belly, which tends to have crispier skin. (Lechon kawali is Filipino style deep-fried pork belly) citeturn0search18  
- If whole-pig roast (lechon) is too much, ask for **chopped lechon** or **lechon cubes** (they roast the pig then chop it) as many restaurants offer.
- Insist the skin is crisp — sometimes in humid environment the skin softens by the time it is served.
- Ask whether they roast over charcoal (for lechon) versus oven / electric, since traditional charcoal roasting gives better flavor and better crackling.  
- Ask if there is a dipping sauce (e.g. “Mang Tomas” — pork liver sauce, or vinegar-based dipping) as Filipino crispy pork is often served with these. citeturn0search13turn0search10turn0search2  

---

If you tell me **which part of Singapore you are (e.g. East, West, near which MRT / neighbourhood)**, I can narrow it down to the closest ones. Do you want me to map out ones near you?
